Package ClientSideTests

Class TestUnit

java.lang.Object
ClientSideTests.TestUnit
public class TestUnit
extends java.lang.Object
The following tests are used to test the functionality of the Unit class.
Author:
Scott Peachey

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor Description
    TestUnit()  

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type Method Description
    void before()
    Before each test, create a unit with mock a asset
    void clearMockObjects()
    After each test, reset the mock unit and asset
    void getAndSetAssets()
    Test the methods for getting and setting the unit's assets
    void getAndSetCredits()
    Test the methods for getting and setting the unit's credits
    void invalidAdjustBalance()
    Make sure InvalidAmount exception is thrown
    void invalidConstruction()
    Make sure IllegalString and InvalidAmount exceptions are thrown
    void setUnitName()
    Test the method for changing the unit's name
    void testUnitConstructor()
    Test that units are constructed correctly

    clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

  • Constructor Details

    • TestUnit

      public TestUnit()

  • Method Details

    • before

      @BeforeEach @DisplayName("Before each... create new unit and assets. Assign one asset to the unit.") public void before() throws InvalidAmount, IllegalString
      Before each test, create a unit with mock a asset
      Throws:
      IllegalString - if unit name is not valid
      InvalidAmount - if unit credits are negative

    • clearMockObjects

      @AfterEach @DisplayName("After each... delete mock unit and asset, clear assets HashMap") public void clearMockObjects()
      After each test, reset the mock unit and asset

    • testUnitConstructor

      @Test @DisplayName("Units constructor assigns the data correctly") public void testUnitConstructor()
      Test that units are constructed correctly

    • getAndSetAssets

      @Test public void getAndSetAssets()
      Test the methods for getting and setting the unit's assets

    • getAndSetCredits

      @Test public void getAndSetCredits() throws InvalidAmount
      Test the methods for getting and setting the unit's credits
      Throws:
      InvalidAmount - Throw an exception if the credits are not a valid amount

    • setUnitName

      @Test public void setUnitName()
      Test the method for changing the unit's name

    • invalidAdjustBalance

      @Test public void invalidAdjustBalance()
      Make sure InvalidAmount exception is thrown

    • invalidConstruction

      @Test public void invalidConstruction()
      Make sure IllegalString and InvalidAmount exceptions are thrown
